description.narrative: Increased awareness and observance of COVID-19 prevention measures among target populations in the target localities of East Darfur.

comment.narrative: • Training of 100 Community-Based Conflict Resolution Mechanisms members(60 women and 40 men) on COVID-19 surveillance, isolating and reporting suspected cases, and outbreak management. • Provide house-to-house COVID-19 messaging on prevention, symptoms identification, social distancing to at least 56,700 people, who will be reached by the 100 trained CBRM members in collaboration with other existing trained health workers in the areas. • Establish three (3) Early Warning and Reporting (EWAR) mechanisms, one per the targeted locality, using the trained village development committees, women and youth association group leaders, and conduct active case surveillance in close coordination with SMOH. • Print 30,000 different Information Education and Communication (IEC) materials in Arabic, including pamphlets, based on FMOH/WHO guidelines to be used at health facilities, public areas, and house-to-house distributions, maintaining social distancing. • Install 40 child friendly hand washing facilities at health facilities and other public gathering areas and provision of soap for three months. • Raising communities awareness using community radio stations for two months, considering the differentiated needs of women, girls, boys, and men in pastoralist, farming, and refugee settings. • Provide assorted Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) to health care service providers in the targeted localities and community outreach workers, if available.

• Trained 100 Community-Based Conflict Resolution Mechanisms members (60 women and 40 men) in COVID-19. This led to increased identification, isolation and reporting suspected cases as well as outbreak management. • Three (3) Early Warning and Reporting (EWAR) mechanisms, one per the targeted locality (Abu Karinka, Assalya and El Deain) were established to conduct active surveillance. This enabled easy follow up of suspected cases of the virus for State Health Officials. • using the trained village development committees, women and youth association group leaders to conduct active case surveillance in close coordination with SMOH. This enabled easy follow up of suspected cases of the virus for State Health Officials. • The project raised awareness and increased community vigilance in the fight against COVID-19 through the distribution of 30,000 different Information Education and Communication (IEC) materials in Arabic including pamphlets, based on FMOH/WHO guidelines to be used at health facilities, public areas, and house-to-house visits reaching at least 56,000 people including pastoralists, farmers, and refugees in the targeted localities. • 10 hand washing stands were set up at various community gathering points including; one in the stabilization Centre in El Daen, two in Jadl-seed Mosque and nutrition Centre, three in Alsunta Market, school and nutrition facility. The child friendly hand washing stands enabled communities to improve their hygiene and follow mandated COVID-19 prevention mechanisms. • 60 radio broadcast were conducted to raise awareness in the community and increase understanding of COVID-19 transmission and prevention. Particular attention was given to mothers in nutrition/stabilization centers who were taught on how to prevent communicable diseases including COVID-19, these mothers were able to take these messages back home to protect their children and families. • Provided assorted Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) for health care service providers in the targeted three localities and community outreach workers enabling them to work without the worry of acquiring the disease or passing it on to their patients and families.
